ground_truth: The balcony starts to collapse, prompting Peter's webs to pull two people away from falling masonry, while MJ is stranded on a swaying piece of the balcony. Peter runs through the crowd, pulling at his clothes to reveal the Spider-Man costume underneath them. A pillar crashes onto a police car, and the glider returns to the balcony where the Green Goblin holds a pumpkin bomb that incinerates the board members. Harry is struck by a piece of masonry and knocked out, as the Green Goblin glides up. Spider-Man swoops down, kicks the goblin from the glider, and the goblin lands on top of a marquee. The glider shoots into and out of a hot air balloon. A little boy stands rooted to the spot as the world unity festival hoarding falls towards him, but Spider-Man rescues him. Police converge on the Green Goblin, who easily punches them with his fist. Spider-Man swings in front of the Green Goblin and throws a punch, but the goblin catches his hand and kicks Spider-Man in the chest, driving him backwards until he stops against a lamp post, which crashes onto a passerby. The goblin leaps back onto the glider, now fitted with guns, and pursues the running Spider-Man, firing at him. A missile narrowly misses Spider-Man, who leaps onto a large inflatable. Hearing MJ's screams, Spider-Man jumps from inflatable to inflatable, using one shaped like a kangaroo as a trampoline. As he bounces towards the balcony, the Green Goblin on the glider grabs him from behind, crashes him against a stained glass window, and repeatedly smashes his head against it. Spider-Man elbows the goblin in the face and breaks free. The two fight until Spider-Man falls towards MJ. The goblin descends on the glider, but Spider-Man shoots a web into the goblin's face and cuts an electric car cell from the underside of the glider. As the goblin escapes, MJ falls from the balcony. Spider-Man dives after her as she plummets towards the ground, catching her in his arm. The web attached to the balcony holds just in time, and they spring back up in the air. Spider-Man swings MJ to safety above the crowd below, and they continue high above the streets of Manhattan as people watch. MJ wraps her arms tightly around Spider-Man, looking around in wonder and awe at the experience and with him. They swing past the twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral and land on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center, surprising a canoodling couple. Spider-Man prepares to leave, somersaults off the roof, and MJ rushes over to see him swinging back and forth over the streets.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The terrace begins to crumble, prompting Peter's threads to tug two individuals away from descending masonry, while MJ is marooned on a rocking fragment of the terrace. Peter dashes through the throng, tugging at his garments to disclose the Spider-Man outfit beneath them. A column crashes onto a patrol automobile, and the glider returns to the terrace where the Green Goblin clutches a pumpkin explosive that incinerates the board associates. Harry is struck by a piece of masonry and rendered unconscious, as the Green Goblin glides upward. Spider-Man swoops downward, kicks the goblin from the glider, and the goblin lands atop a marquee. The glider fires into and out of a hot air balloon. A small boy stands fixed to the spot as the world unity festival billboard plummets towards him, but Spider-Man rescues him. Police gather around the Green Goblin, who effortlessly strikes them with his fist. Spider-Man swings in front of the Green Goblin and delivers a punch, but the goblin grasps his hand and kicks Spider-Man in the chest, propelling him backward until he halts against a lamp post, which crashes onto a bystander. The goblin jumps back onto the glider, now equipped with firearms, and chases the sprinting Spider-Man, firing at him. A projectile narrowly misses Spider-Man, who hops onto a large inflatable. Hearing MJ's cries, Spider-Man vaults from inflatable to inflatable, using one shaped like a kangaroo as a springboard. As he rebounds towards the terrace, the Green Goblin on the glider grabs him from behind, smashes him against a stained glass pane, and repeatedly bashes his head against it. Spider-Man elbows the goblin in the visage and breaks free. The two combat until Spider-Man descends towards MJ. The goblin descends on the glider, but Spider-Man shoots a web into the goblin's face and severs an electric vehicle cell from the underside of the glider. As the goblin flees, MJ falls from the terrace. Spider-Man plunges after her as she plummets towards the earth, catching her in his arm. The web affixed to the terrace holds just in time, and they rebound back up into the air. Spider-Man swings MJ to security above the crowd below, and they continue high above the boulevards of Manhattan as individuals watch. MJ wraps her arms firmly around Spider-Man, looking around in amazement and awe at the journey and with him. They swing past the twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral and land on the rooftop garden of Rockefeller Center, surprising a smooching couple. Spider-Man prepares to depart, flips off the rooftop, and MJ rushes over to observe him swinging back and forth over the boulevards.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The balcony is started to be collapsed, and two people are pulled away from falling masonry by Peter's webs, while MJ is left stranded on a swaying piece of the balcony. The crowd is run through by Peter, who reveals the Spider-Man costume underneath his clothes by pulling at them. A police car is crashed onto by a pillar, and the balcony is returned to by the glider where a pumpkin bomb is held by the Green Goblin, incinerating the board members. A piece of masonry strikes Harry, knocking him out, as the Green Goblin glides up. The goblin is swooped down upon by Spider-Man, who kicks the goblin from the glider, and he lands on top of a marquee. A hot air balloon is shot into and out of by the glider. As a World Unity Festival hoarding falls towards a little boy, Spider-Man rescues him. The Green Goblin is converged on by police, but he easily punches them with his fist. The Green Goblin stands in front of Spider-Man who swings and throws a punch, but his hand is caught by the goblin, who kicks Spider-Man in the chest, driving him backwards until a lamp post is stopped against by him, which crashes onto a passerby. The glider, now fitted with guns, is leapt back onto by the goblin, and Spider-Man is pursued, while firing at him. Spider-Man is narrowly missed by a missile, and he leaps onto a large inflatable. MJ's screams are heard by him, and Spider-Man jumps from inflatable to inflatable, using one shaped like a kangaroo as a trampoline. The Green Goblin on the glider grabs Spider-Man from behind as he bounces towards the balcony, crashing him against a stained glass window, and his head is repeatedly smashed against it. The goblin is elbowed in the face by Spider-Man, and he breaks free. Until Spider-Man falls towards MJ, the two fight. Spider-Man shoots a web into the goblin's face and cuts an electric car cell from under the glider as the goblin descends on the glider. MJ is fallen from the balcony as the goblin escapes. After her, Spider-Man dives as she plummets towards the ground, and she is caught by him in his arm. The web attached to the balcony is held just in time by it, and they are sprung back up in the air. MJ is swung to safety above the crowd below by Spider-Man, and high above the streets of Manhattan, they are continued as people watch. Spider-Man is tightly wrapped around by MJ, who looks around in wonder and awe at the experience with him. Past the twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral, they swing, and a canoodling couple is surprised when they land on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center. Spider-Man prepares to leave, somersaults off the roof, and when he swings back and forth over the streets, he is rushed over to be seen by MJ.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The balcony begins to collapse, causing Peter's webs to pull two people from falling debris, leaving MJ stranded on a swaying section. Peter rushes through the crowd, revealing his Spider-Man costume. A pillar crashes onto a police car, and the Green Goblin returns with a pumpkin bomb, incinerating board members. Harry is knocked unconscious by masonry. Spider-Man kicks the goblin from his glider, and the goblin lands on a marquee. The glider crashes into a hot air balloon. A boy stands frozen as the festival hoarding falls, but Spider-Man saves him. Police surround the Green Goblin, who easily fights them off. Spider-Man confronts the Green Goblin, but the goblin counters, driving Spider-Man back into a lamp post. The goblin, now armed with guns, chases Spider-Man, narrowly missing with a missile. Hearing MJ's screams, Spider-Man bounces off inflatables, with the goblin grabbing him and smashing him into a stained glass window. Spider-Man frees himself and fights until he falls towards MJ. The goblin descends, but Spider-Man webs the goblin's face and disables the glider. The goblin escapes as MJ falls. Spider-Man catches her mid-air; the web holds, and they spring back up. Spider-Man swings MJ to safety above the crowd, continuing through Manhattan as onlookers watch. MJ holds Spider-Man tightly, marveling at the experience. They pass St. Patrick's Cathedral and land on Rockefeller Center's roof garden, surprising a couple. Spider-Man prepares to leave, somersaults off the roof, and MJ watches him swing over the streets.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The balcony collapses, leading Peter's webs to save two people, while MJ is stranded. Peter rushes, revealing his Spider-Man costume. A pillar hits a police car, and Green Goblin returns, incinerating board members. Harry is knocked out. Spider-Man kicks the goblin, who lands on a marquee. The glider hits a hot air balloon. A boy is saved by Spider-Man. Police confront the Goblin, who overpowers them. Spider-Man fights the goblin but is pushed back into a lamp post. Goblin fires guns while pursuing Spider-Man, who leaps onto inflatables. Hearing MJ, Spider-Man jumps to her, but Goblin attacks him. Spider-Man fights back and cuts the glider's electric cell. Goblin escapes, MJ falls, but Spider-Man catches her. They swing safely as people watch, and MJ clings to Spider-Man, amazed. They pass St. Patrick's and land at Rockefeller Center. Spider-Man leaves, and MJ watches him swing away.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The balcony suddenly begins to give way, starting to collapse with alarming speed. This urgent situation prompts Peter Parker, using his webs, to quickly pull two individuals away from the dangerous falling masonry, while at the same time, MJ finds herself stranded on a precariously swaying piece of the balcony. Realizing the urgency of the moment, Peter urgently runs through the crowd, all the while pulling at his clothes to reveal the iconic Spider-Man costume that is hidden underneath. Amidst this chaos, a massive pillar crashes down onto a police car. Meanwhile, the menacing glider ominously returns to the balcony where the Green Goblin is holding a deadly pumpkin bomb, which he uses to incinerate the board members. Harry is unfortunately struck by a piece of masonry, rendering him unconscious, as the Green Goblin rises up on his glider. Spider-Man then dramatically swoops down from above, delivering a decisive kick that knocks the goblin off the glider, causing the goblin to land on top of a prominent marquee. The glider erratically shoots into and out of a hot air balloon. A small boy stands frozen in place, helplessly watching as the world unity festival hoarding falls towards him. Just in time, Spider-Man swoops in to rescue him. The police converge on the Green Goblin, but the goblin easily dispatches them with punches from his powerful fist. Spider-Man swings in to confront the Green Goblin, throwing a punch at him. However, the goblin, with swift reflexes, catches Spider-Man's hand and retaliates with a forceful kick to Spider-Man's chest, driving him backwards until he collides with a lamp post, which then disastrously crashes onto a nearby passerby. The goblin leaps back onto the glider, which is now armed with guns, and pursues Spider-Man, firing bullets as Spider-Man runs. A missile narrowly misses Spider-Man, who manages to leap onto a large inflatable object. Upon hearing MJ's screams for help, Spider-Man quickly jumps from one inflatable to another, utilizing one shaped like a kangaroo as an impromptu trampoline. As he bounces energetically towards the balcony, the Green Goblin on his glider suddenly grabs him from behind in a surprise attack. The goblin then crashes him against a stained glass window, repeatedly smashing Spider-Man's head against it. Fighting back, Spider-Man elbows the goblin in the face, managing to break free. The two continue to battle fiercely until Spider-Man falls towards MJ. As the goblin descends once more on the glider, Spider-Man ingeniously shoots a web directly into the goblin's face and severs an electric car cell from the underside of the glider. Seizing the moment, the goblin makes his escape, but MJ falls from the collapsing balcony. Spider-Man heroically dives after her as she plummets towards the ground, catching her securely in his arm. The web that was attached to the balcony holds just in time, and they both spring back upwards into the air. Spider-Man swings MJ safely above the crowd below, continuing to soar high above the bustling streets of Manhattan, all while onlookers watch in amazement. MJ wraps her arms tightly around Spider-Man, her eyes wide with wonder and awe at both the incredible experience and her steadfast companion. Together, they swing past the iconic twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral and eventually land gently on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center, startling a canoodling couple who were enjoying a romantic moment. Spider-Man, ever vigilant, prepares to leave, somersaulting gracefully off the roof. MJ rushes over to the edge to see him swinging confidently back and forth over the bustling streets below.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The balcony, without any warning, suddenly begins to give way, starting its collapse with alarming and frightening speed. This urgent and dangerous situation prompts Peter Parker to act swiftly, using his trusty webs to quickly pull two individuals away from the dangerously falling masonry. At the same time, MJ finds herself stranded and isolated on a precariously swaying piece of the balcony. Realizing the critical urgency of the moment, Peter urgently runs through the panicked crowd, all the while pulling at his clothes to reveal the iconic Spider-Man costume that he always wears hidden underneath. Amidst this chaotic scene, a massive pillar crashes down violently onto a police car. Meanwhile, the menacing glider ominously returns to the balcony with a sinister aura, where the Green Goblin is holding a deadly pumpkin bomb, which he uses with malice to incinerate the board members. Harry, unfortunately, is struck by a piece of masonry, which renders him unconscious, as the Green Goblin rises up menacingly on his glider. Spider-Man then dramatically swoops down from above, delivering a decisive and powerful kick that knocks the goblin off the glider, causing the goblin to land with a thud on top of a prominent marquee. The glider erratically shoots in and out of a nearby hot air balloon, causing further chaos. A small boy stands frozen in place, watching helplessly as the world unity festival hoarding ominously falls towards him. Just in the nick of time, Spider-Man swoops in heroically to rescue him from harm. The police quickly converge on the Green Goblin, but the goblin easily dispatches them with powerful punches from his forceful fist. Spider-Man swings in valiantly to confront the Green Goblin, throwing a punch at him with determination. However, the goblin, with his swift reflexes and menacing speed, catches Spider-Man's hand and retaliates with a forceful kick to Spider-Man's chest, driving him backwards until he collides with a lamp post, which disastrously crashes onto a nearby passerby. The goblin then leaps back onto the glider, which is now armed with guns, and furiously pursues Spider-Man, firing bullets as Spider-Man runs to evade them. A missile narrowly misses Spider-Man, who manages to leap onto a large inflatable object for safety. Upon hearing MJ's desperate screams for help, Spider-Man quickly jumps from one inflatable to another, utilizing one shaped like a kangaroo as an impromptu trampoline. As he bounces energetically and determinedly towards the balcony, the Green Goblin on his glider suddenly and sneakily grabs him from behind in a surprise attack. The goblin then crashes him relentlessly against a stained glass window, repeatedly smashing Spider-Man's head against it with brutal force. Fighting back, Spider-Man uses his elbow to strike the goblin in the face, managing to break free from his grip. The two continue to battle fiercely and intensely until Spider-Man falls towards MJ. As the goblin descends once again on the glider, Spider-Man ingeniously shoots a web directly into the goblin's face and severs an electric car cell from the underside of the glider. Seizing this opportune moment, the goblin makes his escape, but MJ falls from the collapsing balcony. Spider-Man heroically dives after her as she plummets towards the ground, catching her securely and safely in his arm. The web that was attached to the balcony holds just in the nick of time, and they both spring back upwards into the air. Spider-Man swings MJ safely above the crowd below, continuing to soar high above the bustling streets of Manhattan, all while onlookers watch in amazement and awe. MJ wraps her arms tightly around Spider-Man, her eyes wide with wonder and awe at both the incredible experience and her steadfast and heroic companion. Together, they swing past the iconic twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral and eventually land gently and softly on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center, startling a canoodling couple who were enjoying a romantic moment together. Spider-Man, ever vigilant and always on the lookout, prepares to leave, somersaulting gracefully and elegantly off the roof. MJ rushes over to the edge to watch him swinging confidently back and forth over the bustling streets below.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the balcony begins to shudder and collapse, tiny cracks splintering through the structure, Peter swiftly reacts by instinctively launching his webs to snatch two people, pulling them seamlessly away from the crumbling masonry. Meanwhile, MJ finds herself precariously stranded on a piece of the balcony that sways dangerously beneath her. Peter navigates through the panicking crowd, hurriedly tugging at his clothes to reveal the unmistakable blue and red costume of Spider-Man hidden beneath. With a thunderous crash, a pillar slams onto a police car, creating chaos just as the Green Goblin's glider returns to the balcony. The villain, clutching a deadly pumpkin bomb, launches it to devastating effect, obliterating the board members in an instant. Amidst the chaos, a fragment of masonry strikes Harry, rendering him unconscious, as the Green Goblin ascends skyward on his glider. Spider-Man, with precision timing, descends with a swoop, delivering a powerful kick that ejects the goblin from the glider and sends him tumbling onto a marquee. The glider, seemingly autonomous, darts through a hot air balloon, slicing through the fabric with ease. A little boy stands frozen, eyes wide with terror, as the world unity festival hoarding teeters, threatening to crush him, but Spider-Man intervenes, snatching the boy to safety just in time. Police swarm the Green Goblin, who easily dispatches them with powerful punches. Spider-Man, ever the hero, swings into action, confronting the Green Goblin with a deliberate punch, only for the villain to catch his fist and viciously kick him in the chest. The force propels Spider-Man backward until he collides with a lamppost, which topples onto a bystander with a resounding crash. The Green Goblin seamlessly leaps back onto his glider, now bristling with weaponry, and begins to pursue Spider-Man, firing relentlessly. A missile streaks past Spider-Man, narrowly missing him as he deftly leaps onto a large inflatable. At the sound of MJ's piercing screams, determination fuels Spider-Man's movements as he bounds from inflatable to inflatable, using one fashioned like a kangaroo to propel himself higher, like a trampoline. As he zeroes in on the balcony, the Green Goblin, stealthily maneuvering his glider, grabs Spider-Man from behind and brutally rams him against a stained glass window, repeatedly smashing his head against it. With a swift elbow to the goblin's face, Spider-Man breaks free, and the two engage in a fierce struggle until Spider-Man plummets downward, hurtling toward MJ. The Green Goblin looms closer on his glider, but Spider-Man resourcefully shoots a web into the goblin's face and deftly severs an electric car cell from the glider's underbelly. As the goblin retreats into the distance, MJ is unceremoniously thrown from the balcony, spiraling downwards. With barely a moment to spare, Spider-Man dives after her, catching her securely in his arm as they descend. The web tethered to the balcony holds firm, and together they rebound upwards, defying gravity momentarily. Spider-Man ensures MJ's safety by swinging her over the awestruck crowd below, and they continue to travel high above the Manhattan streets, the city a blur beneath them. MJ clings tightly to Spider-Man, wide-eyed with amazement and astonishment at the surreal experience shared between them. They glide past the iconic twin spires of St. Patrick’s Cathedral, their silhouettes briefly outlined against the sky, before landing gently on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center, where they inadvertently startle a couple wrapped in a private moment. Spider-Man, sensing his cue to depart, prepares himself with a poised somersault off the roof, and MJ instinctively rushes forward, catching a final glimpse of him as he swings gracefully back and forth over the bustling streets below.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the balcony begins to collapse, Peter quickly uses his webs to rescue two people from falling debris while MJ is left stranded on a swaying section. He runs through the crowd, revealing his Spider-Man costume beneath his clothes. Amidst the chaos, the Green Goblin returns, incinerating board members with a pumpkin bomb, while a crashing pillar knocks Harry unconscious. Spider-Man intervenes, knocking the Goblin from his glider, which disruptively navigates through a hot air balloon. He saves a boy from falling debris as police are overpowered by the Goblin. Spider-Man confronts the Goblin, but their fight results in him being kicked against a lamp post. The Goblin mounts his armed glider, chasing Spider-Man while firing at him. A missile narrowly misses Spider-Man, who then leaps onto inflatables and uses them as trampolines, moving towards MJ's screams. As he nears her, the Goblin seizes him, smashing him into a stained glass window. Spider-Man frees himself with an elbow strike, continuing the fight until he falls towards MJ. Spider-Man webs the Goblin's face, disabling the glider's electric cell. The Goblin retreats as MJ falls. Spider-Man dives, catching her mid-fall, and their web holds, allowing them to spring back into the air. He swings MJ to safety high above the streets, where she clings to him in awe. They pass St. Patrick's Cathedral's spires and land on a rooftop garden, surprising a couple. Spider-Man somersaults off the roof, leaving MJ to watch him swing across the city.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As the balcony starts to collapse during the chaotic scene, prompting Peter's webs to pull two people away from falling masonry from a century-old architectural feature, MJ is stranded on a precariously swaying piece of the balcony. Peter runs frantically through the crowd gathered at the World Unity Festival, pulling at his clothes to reveal the iconic Spider-Man costume underneath them. A heavy stone pillar crashes onto a parked police car, and the menacing glider returns to the balcony where the Green Goblin, Spider-Man's arch-nemesis known for his technological prowess and malice, holds a pumpkin bomb that incinerates the board members of Oscorp, his own company. Harry, Peter's best friend and heir to the Oscorp legacy, is struck by a piece of masonry and knocked out, as the Green Goblin glides up in triumph. Spider-Man swoops down, executing a swift aerial maneuver, and kicks the goblin from the glider, and the goblin lands on top of a nearby theater marquee. The glider, equipped with advanced weaponry, shoots into and out of a hot air balloon, which had been part of the festival's decorations. A little boy stands rooted to the spot, paralyzed with fear, as the World Unity Festival hoarding falls toward him, but Spider-Man heroically rescues him just in time. Police converge on the Green Goblin, who easily punches them with his enhanced fist, a result of his experimental serum. Spider-Man swings in front of the Green Goblin and throws a punch, but the goblin, wearing high-tech armor, catches his hand and kicks Spider-Man in the chest, driving him backwards until he stops against a lamp post, which crashes onto a passerby. The goblin leaps back onto the glider, now ominously fitted with guns, and pursues the agile Spider-Man, firing at him with lethal intent. A missile narrowly misses Spider-Man, who leaps onto a large inflatable, part of the festival's attractions. Hearing MJ's screams, Spider-Man jumps from inflatable to inflatable, using one shaped like a kangaroo as a trampoline. As he bounces towards the balcony, the relentless Green Goblin on the glider grabs him from behind, crashing him against a stained glass window of a historic building, and repeatedly smashes his head against it. Spider-Man elbows the goblin in the face and breaks free. The two continue their fierce fight until Spider-Man falls towards MJ. The goblin descends on the glider, but Spider-Man shoots a web into the goblin's face, momentarily blinding him, and cuts an electric propulsion cell from the underside of the glider. As the goblin escapes, MJ falls from the balcony, screaming. Spider-Man dives after her as she plummets towards the ground, catching her in his arm in a heart-stopping moment. The web attached to the balcony holds just in time, and they spring back up into the air. Spider-Man swings MJ to safety above the throng of festival-goers below, and they continue their thrilling flight high above the streets of Manhattan as people watch in awe. MJ wraps her arms tightly around Spider-Man, looking around in wonder at the breathtaking experience with him. They swing past the twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral, a New York City landmark, and land on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center, surprising a couple enjoying a romantic moment. Spider-Man prepares to leave, somersaults off the roof with his characteristic agility, and MJ rushes over to see him swinging back and forth over the bustling streets.

Police converge on the Green Goblin who easily punches them with his fist. SpiderMan swings in front of the Green Goblin and throws a punch but the goblin catches his hand and kicks SpiderMan in the chest driving him backwards until he stops against a lamp post which crashes onto a passerby. The goblin leaps back onto the glider now fitted with guns and pursues the running SpiderMan firing at him. A missile narrowly misses SpiderMan who leaps onto a large inflatable. Hearing MJ's screams SpiderMan jumps from inflatable to inflatable using one shaped like a kangaroo as a trampoline. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. As he bounces towards the balcony the Green Goblin on the glider grabs him from behind crashes him against a stained glass window and repeatedly smashes his head against it. SpiderMan elbows the goblin in the face and breaks free. The two fight until SpiderMan falls towards MJ. The goblin descends on the glider but SpiderMan shoots a web into the goblin's face and cuts an electric car cell from the underside of the glider. As the goblin escapes MJ falls from the balcony. SpiderMan dives after her as she plummets towards the ground catching her in his arm. The web attached to the balcony holds just in time and they spring back up in the air. SpiderMan swings MJ to safety above the crowd below and they continue high above the streets of Manhattan. as people watch. MJ wraps her arms tightly around SpiderMan looking around in wonder and awe at the experience and with him. They swing past the twin spires of St Patrick's Cathedral and land on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center surprising a canoodling couple. SpiderMan prepares to leave somersaults off the roof and MJ rushes over to see him swinging back and forth over the streets.

test_cases.description: The balcony starts to collapse prompting Peter's webs to pull two people away from falling masonry. while MJ is stranded on a swaying piece of the balcony Peter runs through the crowd pulling at his clothes to reveal the SpiderMan costume underneath them. A pillar crashes onto a police car and the glider returns to the balcony where the Green Goblin holds a pumpkin bomb that incinerates the board members. Harry is struck by a piece of masonry and knocked out as the Green Goblin glides up. SpiderMan swoops down kicks the goblin from the glider and the goblin lands on top of a marquee. The glider shoots into and out of a hot air balloon. The web attached to the balcony holds just in time and they spring back up in the air. SpiderMan swings MJ to safety above the crowd below and they continue high above the streets of Manhattan. as people watch. MJ wraps her arms tightly around SpiderMan looking around in wonder and awe at the experience and with him. They swing past the twin spires of St Patrick's Cathedral and land on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center surprising a canoodling couple. SpiderMan prepares to leave somersaults off the roof and MJ rushes over to see him swinging back and forth over the streets.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: The balcony starts to collapse prompting Peter's webs to pull two people away from falling masonry. while MJ is stranded on a swaying piece of the balcony Peter runs through the crowd pulling at his clothes to reveal the SpiderMan costume underneath them. A pillar crashes onto a police car and the glider returns to the balcony where the Green Goblin holds a pumpkin bomb that incinerates the board members. They swing past the twin spires of St Patrick's Cathedral and land on the roof garden of Rockefeller Center surprising a canoodling couple. SpiderMan prepares to leave somersaults off the roof and MJ rushes over to see him swinging back and forth over the streets.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The treetop starts to disintegrate, prompting Lucy's vines to yank three cats away from flying lanterns, while Otto is marooned on a tilting chunk of the treetop. Lucy dances through the forest, tearing at her jacket to display the Owl-Woman armor underneath it. A boulder crashes onto a wagon, and the blimp returns to the treetop where the Orange Wizard grips an apple pie that evaporates the jury members. Simon is hit by a chunk of lantern and knocked down, as the Orange Wizard sails up. Owl-Woman dives down, nudges the wizard off the blimp, and the wizard plummets onto a canopy. The blimp zooms into and out of a dirigible. A small pig stands frozen to the spot as the harmony carnival banner tumbles towards it, but Owl-Woman saves it. Guards gather around the Orange Wizard, who effortlessly slaps them with his palm. Owl-Woman swings beside the Orange Wizard and delivers a kick, but the wizard catches her leg and elbows Owl-Woman in the shoulder, pushing her backwards until she lands against a signpost, which collapses onto a pedestrian. The wizard jumps back onto the blimp, now armed with cannons, and chases the skipping Owl-Woman, shooting at her. A rocket barely grazes Owl-Woman, who vaults onto a massive inflatable. Hearing Otto's cries, Owl-Woman leaps from floaty to floaty, using one shaped like a platypus as a springboard. As she bounds towards the treetop, the Orange Wizard on the blimp grabs her from behind, smashes her against a stained glass portal, and relentlessly bangs her head against it. Owl-Woman knees the wizard in the jaw and breaks loose. The two scuffle until Owl-Woman plummets towards Otto. The wizard descends on the blimp, but Owl-Woman tosses a vine into the wizard's helmet and detaches a solar panel from the underside of the blimp. As the wizard flees, Otto tumbles from the treetop. Owl-Woman dives after him as he plunges towards the earth, catching him in her talon. The vine tied to the treetop holds just in time, and they rebound into the sky. Owl-Woman swings Otto to security above the animals below, and they continue soaring high above the treetops of the jungle as critters watch. Otto clasps his paws tightly around Owl-Woman, gazing around in astonishment and delight at the adventure and with her. They swing past the twin peaks of St. Patrick's Monument and land on the sky garden of Rockefeller Tower, startling a napping pair. Owl-Woman prepares to depart, flips off the garden, and Otto scurries over to see her oscillating back and forth over the wilderness.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The balcony begins to collapse, and Peter uses his webs to save two people from falling debris while MJ is left stranded. Peter races through the crowd, revealing his Spider-Man suit, as the Green Goblin incinerates board members and attacks. After rescuing a little boy from falling debris, Spider-Man confronts the Green Goblin, who punches police away before fighting Spider-Man. The Goblin pursues Spider-Man with firearms, narrowly missing him. Hearing MJ's screams, Spider-Man uses inflatables to reach her, but the Goblin captures him, smashing him into a window. Spider-Man breaks free, and as MJ falls, Spider-Man catches her mid-air. The balcony web holds, allowing them to spring back up safely. Spider-Man swings MJ to safety above the crowd, and they travel across Manhattan as onlookers marvel. MJ clings to Spider-Man in awe as they pass landmarks and land on a rooftop, surprising a couple. Spider-Man prepares to leave, somersaulting from the roof as MJ watches him swing away.
